screen.name: MessageBox
screen.title: Message
screen.applet:
from enigma import eSize, ePoint
# ── constants ─────────────────────────────────────────────── LEFT_PAD, RIGHT_PAD, TOP_PAD = 108, 70, 12 # icon gap, right margin, top gap ROW_H = 50 # height of one list row MIN_LIST_ROWS = 2 # at least 2 rows if list not empty MAX_LIST_ROWS = 13 MIN_TXT_H = 104 # ← new minimum text height MIN_W, MAX_W = 689, 1200 MAX_H = 900 # absolute height ceiling BOTTOM_MARGIN = 10 # gap under list FB_W, FB_H = 1920, 1080 # framebuffer size
# ── 1) list rows and height ────────────────────────────────── rows_real = min(len(self.list), MAX_LIST_ROWS) # 0 … 13 rows_show = 0 if rows_real == 0 else max(rows_real, MIN_LIST_ROWS) list_h = rows_show * ROW_H # 0 or ≥ 100 px
# ── 2) measure text at provisional max width ─────────────── avail_w = MAX_W - (LEFT_PAD + RIGHT_PAD) self["text"].instance.resize(eSize(avail_w, 9999)) txt_w_raw, txt_h_raw = self["text"].getSize()
# ── 3) clamp window width and re-measure text ────────────── win_w = txt_w_raw + LEFT_PAD + RIGHT_PAD if win_w < MIN_W: win_w = MIN_W elif win_w > MAX_W: win_w = MAX_W
text_w = win_w - (LEFT_PAD + RIGHT_PAD) self["text"].instance.resize(eSize(text_w, 9999)) txt_h_raw = self["text"].getSize()[1] txt_h = txt_h_raw + (TOP_PAD * 2)
# ensure text block ≥ MIN_TXT_H if txt_h < MIN_TXT_H: txt_h = MIN_TXT_H self["text"].instance.resize(eSize(text_w, txt_h - TOP_PAD * 2))
# ── 4) required total height with full list ──────────────── needed_h = txt_h + list_h + BOTTOM_MARGIN
# if it overflows, collapse list to 2 rows if needed_h > MAX_H and rows_real: list_h = MIN_LIST_ROWS * ROW_H # 100 px needed_h = txt_h + list_h + BOTTOM_MARGIN
# if it still overflows, crop text (but never below MIN_TXT_H) if needed_h > MAX_H: txt_h_available = MAX_H - list_h - BOTTOM_MARGIN if txt_h_available < MIN_TXT_H: txt_h_available = MIN_TXT_H self["text"].instance.resize(eSize(text_w, txt_h_available - TOP_PAD * 2)) txt_h = txt_h_available needed_h = txt_h + list_h + BOTTOM_MARGIN
# ── 5) apply final sizes ─────────────────────────────────── self.instance.resize(eSize(win_w, needed_h)) self["list"].instance.move(ePoint(10, txt_h)) self["list"].instance.resize(eSize(win_w - 20, list_h))
# ── 6) centre dialog on 1920 × 1080 framebuffer ──────────── self.instance.move(ePoint((FB_W - win_w) // 2, (FB_H - needed_h) // 2))

# ── constants ─────────────────────────────────────────────── LEFT_PAD, RIGHT_PAD, TOP_PAD = 108, 70, 12 # icon gap, right margin, top gap ROW_H = 50 # height of one list row MIN_LIST_ROWS = 2 # at least 2 rows if list not empty MAX_LIST_ROWS = 13 MIN_TXT_H = 104 # ← new minimum text height MIN_W, MAX_W = 689, 1200 MAX_H = 900 # absolute height ceiling BOTTOM_MARGIN = 10 # gap under list FB_W, FB_H = 1920, 1080 # framebuffer size
# ── 1) list rows and height ────────────────────────────────── rows_real = min(len(self.list), MAX_LIST_ROWS) # 0 … 13 rows_show = 0 if rows_real == 0 else max(rows_real, MIN_LIST_ROWS) list_h = rows_show * ROW_H # 0 or ≥ 100 px
# ── 2) measure text at provisional max width ─────────────── avail_w = MAX_W - (LEFT_PAD + RIGHT_PAD) self["text"].instance.resize(eSize(avail_w, 9999)) txt_w_raw, txt_h_raw = self["text"].getSize()
# ── 3) clamp window width and re-measure text ────────────── win_w = txt_w_raw + LEFT_PAD + RIGHT_PAD if win_w < MIN_W: win_w = MIN_W elif win_w > MAX_W: win_w = MAX_W
text_w = win_w - (LEFT_PAD + RIGHT_PAD) self["text"].instance.resize(eSize(text_w, 9999)) txt_h_raw = self["text"].getSize()[1] txt_h = txt_h_raw + (TOP_PAD * 2)
# ensure text block ≥ MIN_TXT_H if txt_h < MIN_TXT_H: txt_h = MIN_TXT_H self["text"].instance.resize(eSize(text_w, txt_h - TOP_PAD * 2))

# if it still overflows, crop text (but never below MIN_TXT_H) if needed_h > MAX_H: txt_h_available = MAX_H - list_h - BOTTOM_MARGIN if txt_h_available < MIN_TXT_H: txt_h_available = MIN_TXT_H self["text"].instance.resize(eSize(text_w, txt_h_available - TOP_PAD * 2)) txt_h = txt_h_available needed_h = txt_h + list_h + BOTTOM_MARGIN
# ── 5) apply final sizes ─────────────────────────────────── self.instance.resize(eSize(win_w, needed_h)) self["list"].instance.move(ePoint(10, txt_h)) self["list"].instance.resize(eSize(win_w - 20, list_h))
# ── 6) centre dialog on 1920 × 1080 framebuffer ──────────── self.instance.move(ePoint((FB_W - win_w) // 2, (FB_H - needed_h) // 2))
